derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'countrify'): from Latin rusticat- ('having) lived in the country', from the verb rusticari, from rusticus (see rustic)

means.word_mean: 1. live in the country and lead a rustic life

sentences.sentence: "He was rusticated for his bad bahavior"

means.word_mean: 3. suspend temporarily from college or university, in England
4. as of stone, to give it a rustic look
